intro: Galium tenuissimum var. adrianopolitanum, commonly known as Adrianopolitan narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild astringent properties.
